Arne Meier

Private Lecturer (Privatdozent)
Leibniz Universität Hannover, Institut für Theoretische Informatik
meier (at) thi (dot) uni-hannover (dot) de


Hello, nice to have you here.

I am a private lecturer (german: Privatdozent) at the Gottfried Wilmhelm Leibniz Universität Hannover, Germany. I am working at the Institute of Theoretical Computer Science, where I also did my Bachelor and Master Degree in Computer Science as well as my PhD and Habilitation.

Research Interests

  • Complexity Theory: problem complexity, parameterised complexity
  • Logic in Computer Science: non-classical, non-monotonic, team, temporal, hybrid, modal, default, and autopistemic logic
  • Enumeration: parameterised enumeration, enumeration complexity

News

  • [Feb. 2023] Started this webpage ;-)

Projects

Active

  • [DFG] Team Logics: New Bridges to Database Repairs
    [starting in Summer'23]

Finished

  • [DAAD] Descriptive Complexity of Parameterised Counting Classes
    [01'2018 − 12'2019]
  • [DFG] Nonclassical logics: parametrised and enumeration complexity
    [10'2013 − 07'2022]
  • [MWK] Innovation Plus: Komplexität von Algorithmen
    [02'2020 − 09'2022]
